result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip R. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample within 30 days and pay surcharge 
Cash bond applied; 60 days to pay balance

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip R. Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Phillip R.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

2:22 PM Defendant Phillip R. Smith appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant wants to accept an offer and has filled out the paperwork and sent it in.  
Atty Juech states plea agreement. Defendant agrees.
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 

Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Pay $100 + costs = $673.50
Submit DNA sample within 60 days and pay surcharge 
Cash bond to be applied
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office
Status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:22 AM Defendant Phillip R. Smith appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Court confirms address and phone.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Court questions defendant and finds waiver is made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Set for status.  Status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
